headline: Cabbage Roll Casserole
description: This cabbage roll casserole combines chopped cabbage with ground beef, tomato sauce, and rice. It's easer to make than standard stuffed cabbage rolls!

video.name: How to Make Cabbage Roll Casserole

name: Cabbage Roll Casserole

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and gather all ingredients.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.
Combine cabbage, tomato sauce, onion, rice, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Stir in cooked ground beef. Pour mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish, then pour beef broth over top.
Cover and bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour.
Stir, re-cover, and bake until cabbage is tender and rice is done, 20 to 30 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: For those of you who find cabbage rolls and casseroles too bland, try adding cinnamon.

My husband said it was better than cabbage rolls! I followed other reviews and cooked onions and garlic before adding the cooked hamburger in the frying pan. I also added Worcestershire sauce, basil, oregano, lots of salt, pepper, and some red pepper flakes into the hamburger mixture. Great suggestions! I used spaghetti sauce rather than tomato sauce because I didn‚Äôt have any. I threw in some shredded cheese into the combined mixture before cooking. When taking off the cover after an hour, extra cheese was put in top of the 2 containers before cooking for another 10 minutes.

Delicious and so easy. I use coleslaw for the cabbage. 1 lb real ground beef plus equivalent amount vegan "beef" crumbles with onion and garlic while browning. Chicken broth instead of beef plus about a tablespoon vegetarian "beef" Better Than Bullion. for a deeper, richer flavor. Used about 1.5 cup or so basmati rice which I partially cooked in the microwave, (directions on back of rice package) before adding it to the rest of the mixture. Just a bit of black pepper. I'm about to make it again with all vegan "beef"crumbles.

Excellent recipe. Our family likes the taste and texture of this recipe. However, I added garlic, black pepper, liquid smoke (about 1 generous tsp, and paprika. Fresh out of the oven, I garnished with grated cheese. I served this dish with fresh kale salad and toasted english muffins that just happened to be on sale. This dish is very easy and can be prepared much earlier in the day. I let this "rest" for about 10 minutes prior to serving. Family rave review.

I have made this a few times, and it was always great. To beat the oft noted "the rice didn't cook", and because we don't eat white rice, I used instant brown rice. Solves that problem, and very yummy. I, too, spiced it up a bit, but if I still had littles, I would make it as written.
I used four cheese sauce and a bit of Frank's for some zip. Very good and quite easy to make.

It was just okay. The rice nevet cooked. I had to put it in the fridge and order food out. I'm going to try to salvage it by putting it in a pot and simmering it for a bit. Well that didn't work, so I put it in a crock pot and added more beef broth to turn it into a soup. That worked, but my family said it was edible, but just okay. I won't make this again.
It was okay! It tasted more like goulash than it did cabbage rolls! Traditionally you use tomato soup when you make cabbage rolls so next time I will use soup rather than tomato sauce.

This is delicious! I did make changes. I added a chopped red pepper & a few garlic cloves that I sauteed with the onion before adding to the cooked meat. I added smoked paprika, salt & pepper, garlic powder & seasoned salt, a large can of diced tomatoes & a can of tomato soup. I also wilted in the cabbage in a small amount of boiling water. I added half the cabbage to the roaster, topped with the meat & rice mixture, topped with remaining cabbage & poured tomato juice over to cover. After two hours the rice was not done. I will cook the rice until just about done next time I make this.
Good but not enough rice. So we'll be doubling the rice.
Liked it, nice and easy to make. It definitely needs some more spices to give it more zip. Overall we enjoyed and already planning to make it again with more garlic and some other spices...

As with most recipes here it was delicious. I also cut in half as there are only three of us for dinner tonight. I would definitely serve this to a crowd as well, inexpensive and good to eat. Sometimes I add paprika for a little richer flavor.
Quick, fast, and easy! I added 1/2 cup brown sugar for a sweeter sauce. you can Also exchange the cabbage for a bag of coleslaw mix. YUM.
Very good & hearty recipe. I recommend adding a can for Ro-Tel diced tomatoes & chopped fresh garlic, to add a little "kick."

Nice recipe üòçüòç This is almost exactly how I cook this at my restaurant and at home for my family. üëâ Feel free to check out my recipes that I use at my restaurant by visiting my profile ü§ó Enjoy!
I loved this recipe. I did add ground thyme, and minced garlic. Its just me so I cut the recipe in half. It was so yummy. I will make this again.

I veganized this by substituting the meat for cooked brown lentils and used two meatless beef flavoured stock cubes (McCormicks brand).I also added two bay leaves, chopped garlic and lots of black pepper. I think next time I‚Äôll try it leaving the lentils uncooked. It was simple but tasty comfort food. Thank you. If you love animals, don‚Äôt eat them. üå±üíöüòä

Followed discobunny's advice and it was amazing!! My boys loved it! I love when they are shoveling food in and moaning "mmmmm good Mom good!!!" Excellent recipe!! (2tsps oregano and basil, 1 tsp salt/pepper, healthy dashes of crushed red pepper and Cayenne pepper.

I‚Äôve been looking for a good, easy and tasty way to have cabbage rolls without all the work. This recipe works for me. Because my brother is crazy for cabbage rolls I put the recipe in 2 8x8 pans. I added a tsp. each of Worcestershire, cider vinegar, and minced garlic to the recipe because we like lots of seasoning/favor in our food. I added the onion, salt and pepper to the burger when I browned it. And lastly I added a can of diced tomatoes for more texture. The casseroles are baking right now and our mouths are watering. Thanks for sharing the recipe!
Definitely takes a larger dish. Probably would fit two lasagna pans, be a really good recipe to halve.

This recipe makes a great starting point but you have to add your own seasonings. I used 1 lb ground turkey. I added Worcestershire sauce and some white wine vinegar, salt and pepper, and garlic. And I made it in a Dutch oven. It came out a little soupy and took 2 hours, but it's delicious!

So delicious! I made 1/2 of the recipe and added some black pepper and garlic powder to the mix. I also cut the baking time by 1/3 by bringing the beef broth to a boil, then pouring over the mix. I also topped it with shredded cheddar cheese the last 10 minutes of baking. SO GOOD!
I added a bit more Cabbage for taste üòã

Excellent. MUCH easier and just as good as cabbage rolls. I would point out that more spices are suggested in the video than in the text recipe. The spices make it much much better in all cabbage rolls.
Very good
Delicious!
I added 2 strips of bacon,sauteed with the onion. 1/4 cup Worcester sauce 1 tsp red pepper flakes This really spice it up-it was rather bland as originally written
This was a great recipe. It tasted even better the second day.

what the video maker did was not reflected in the recipe...which did not include garlic, black pepper or paprika. i wondered about the omission of paprika, but didn't watch the video until i had already put mine in the oven
Less decorative than I thought. Tastes good!
This is a really easy recipe!

Made a 1/2 portion and was more than enough for 4 people. I added worchester sause to hamburger and then again to mixture as a whole and added heaping tablespoon of brown sugar to hamburger. This was delicious!!'

Ok, I made this as it is written for the most part. I only had 2.5 lbs of cabbage and it was a good thing , too. This was way too much for a 9x13 casserole dish. I did manage to get it all in the dish and into the oven. 50 minutes later I removed it from the oven and dumped the whole thing into my dutch oven and finished cooking it on the stove top. I made this because my husband loves cabbage. He thinks it tastes ok and he will eat it but I'm not a big fan. Not much flavor.
I really did like it. It was more like a soup than a casserole. But very tasty! It earned a spot in my freezer!
It is delicious! I added fresh sliced mushrooms. I also added shredded cheese on top for the last ten minutes!

I am an experienced cook and when I made this I was very disappointed. Needs more seasoning and even after 90 plus 30 more minutes the rice did not get cooked. I used regular long grain white rice as recipe doesn't specify quick cook rice. I turned the oven up to 400 for 30 minutes to get the liquid hot enough to cook the rice. Still not done. I will not make this again.
I used spaghetti sauce instead of tomato sauce. It gave it the flavor it needed. I put shredded mozzarella cheese before done. Very good

Great recipe. First time I made it exactly as written. Tasted great. Even better the next day. I did made some changes the next time. Cut the tomato sauce in half & added 6 cloves of chopped garlic & increased cabbage amount. These were all personal choices. Think you should make the recipe actually like called for he first time. I think kids will love the basic recipe as written. For me I just love to customize to things I know I like in dishes. Very good recipe to add to your families table.

To the reviews to the person cook, did you follow the recipe as directed?
The raw rice should make the cabbage saggy

I did not change a thing on the recipe. It turned out wonderfully! Very delicious. I think its the dill that sends it home. I would definitely recommend. Thanks for sharing. Only tip I would have to offer.... try not to over cook your cabbage.
Good as written, but needs the other seasonings to really be good.

This recipe was terrible. I guess I should have read some other reviews first. I made it exactly as the recipe said. First of all the 9x13 pan was too small but I made it fit. First mistake? I baked it for one hour and it was far from done. Rice and cabbage under done and the whole thing still very soupy. So I increased the temp to 375 and cooked it uncovered for 30 minutes more. Still far from done. So I put the whole thing in a large skillet and cooked on top of the stove for another 30 minutes. We ate it at that time but dinner very late and certainly not worth the effort!

I cut the recipe in half with the meat and swapped in tomatoe soup (as I grew up using for regular halupki) this came out SOOO good. Very easy to prepare and make as compared to softening the cabbage and making the rolls..i will definitely be making this again!!
very tasty. I swapped out ground chicken and turkey for the beef and riced palmini for the rice.
It was OK but too 'soupy '. Will change it up next time. And why is the video recipe different than the printed version, confusing.

First the video for this recipe does not match the written recipe and second, when i made this the rice came out mushy and the cabbage was underdone and i was using regular rice NOT instant or parboiled types. taste wise it was good. i think an alternative method would be to leave out the rice and cook it separately and top it with the cabbage mixture. i would leave out most of the beef broth since it is used for cooking the rice but i would also put some into the mix to create a bit of sauce in the cabbage.
Liked it. I added rolled oats instead of rice.
Don‚Äôt waste your ingredients on this recipe. Was terrible. No taste and after cooking required amount of time the cabbage was not done either.
There is way too much cabbage in this. We ate it once but couldn't bring ourselves to eat the leftovers.

A Delicious one pan meal and easily feeds a crowd.
I made it for my in-laws and they loved it.
Some great add-on toppings are cheese, sour cream and hot sauce.
This is great! I did modify the recipe by using the very flavorful onion beef broth and a lb of Italian sausage meat and a lb of ground beef. Also topped it off off with some cheddar cheese.

I have made this a couple of times, and every time I make it there are no leftovers. I took the advice of another and made the recipe in a pot. (leaving the oven part out.) I do go heavy on the seasonings. All in all, a great recipe and simple to prepare.

I made this for the first time it was really good whoever said in the review they didn‚Äôt like it cabbage was soggy they did something wrong because my cabbage was perfect ty for the wonderful recipe
I love cabbage rolls but can never make the rolls correctly so this casserole is perfect for me! I halved it and it came out great!
We thought this dish was very bland. Admittedly we don't have much experience with cabbage rolls in our background. The texture and consistency was good, just a kind of blah in the taste department.
I tried to follow this as close as I could but I had to adjust it for size (less people eating tonight.) I used a lb less meat, a jar of Prego, 2/3 cup rice, has toless beef broth (

Rice never cooked. I even cooked it for extra time since I used brown rice and the rice was crunchy. Also the mixture was kind of soupy and some of the cabbage was tough. Otherwise it tasted okay. I am just kind of disappointed. Next time if there is a next time I may precook the rice or cook this recipe in a pressure cooker.

Everything about this recipe came out wrong. First of all there was way too much for a 9 by 13 pan, even using 1 pound less cabbage than recipe called for. Second, the rice was not even close to being cooked after an hour and a half, even at 375 degrees. I cooked for over 2 hours and then the cabbage was mushy. Third, very bland tasting and needed a lot of spicing up. I‚Äôll be finding a different recipe as this one was a waste of ingredients.

Love the flavor (I added my own combination of spices, per reviews). This is so much easier than making cabbage rolls! I cut the cooking time to 60 minutes. When I opened the oven to stir, the cabbage and rice were done, so I took it out to avoid it becoming too mushy.

Loved it! I cut the recipe in half, saut√©ed the onions with the beef then added minced garlic, seasoning salt and black pepper. I added extra beef broth and tomato sauce. I also used the boil in a bag white rice, it cooks so much quicker and everything gets done at the same time!
I liked it it...hey, I think getting the hang of this casserole thing!
I loved this recipe easy to follow the only thing I did different was add to the mixture ...worechester sauce and soya sauce delicious
Everyone loved it.
It was very good and easy to make
Made a half batch, using ground turkey in place of beef. Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing, Tasty, easy, and cheap. Leftovers freeze well.
Excellent flavour and so easy to make!
Excellent. Used prepared tomato spaghetti sauce.
I added petite diced tomatoes and crushed garlic to the recipe

Very simple and tasty. Followed recipe except for cooking the onion with the beef and adding minced garlic to it. Stirred everything together in the pan I baked it in. Added some herbs also. Sprinkled some shredded cheese on it for the last few minutes. It was very good, my husband and I both liked it. My only complaint was that the rice ended up overcooked. Next time I'll check the rice earlier to see if it's done.
That said I will definitely make it again.

I also made this using the stove top method as some other reviewers did.. I cooked it until the rice was done. It turned into a big batch of mushy near and rice. The cabbage was practically non existent even though I added it towards the end of the process. My husband said it was ok but he wouldn't out it in the "rotation". If I try it again, I will cook the cabbage, rice and meat separately then combine before putting in the oven to heat through.

Used brown rice instead as that is what I already had opened. 
It came out still undercooked in spots. Would parboil or use instant rice next time. Flavor was so so, but maybe I'm not as big of a cabbage roll fan as I thought. My Polish husband was not very excited by this casserole.

IT WAS GREAT TWEEKED IT JUST A LITTLE. USED SALSA INSTEAD OF TOMATO SAUCE ADDED A LITTLE DILL,A FEW RED PEPPER FLAKES IF U LIKE 1/2 HANBERGER I/2SAUGE MEAT ITALIAN OR WHAT EVER U PLEASE.WHISTERSAURE,THIS IS MY 3RD TIME MAKING IT HUABAND REALLY LIKED NOT MUCH FOR CASSAROLE'S LOL
I made this with ground pork instead and added some all purpose seasoning. It was delicious!

The recipe on the page and the recipe in the video are different! Video says use 12x18 inch pan, not 9x13, use of garlic, optional shredded carrots, seasoning with paprika, and serving with sour cream and chopped parsley.

I was out of white rice so I used Uncle Ben's mexican rice. It added the perfect amount of zip to it. Sprinkled some crushed chilies, basil, oregano and extra salt/pepper. I also used up my beef broth that had the red wine in it. It really is tasty

I was out of white rice so I used Uncle Ben's mexican rice. It added the perfect amount of zip to it. Sprinkled some crushed chilies, basil, oregano and extra salt/pepper. I also used up my beef broth that had the red wine in it. It really is tasty

I was planning on making the cabbage Roll, but when I saw this recipe for cabbage roll casserole, I decided to make this one instead.
I did make some changes:
I layered the dish with cabbage leaves,
I used one 8oz can of tomato sauce & 8oz of mild salsa.
I poured two 10 1/2 cans of cheddar cheese over the casserole after cooking time was up, then placed casserole back in the oven uncovered for 30 minutes.

Followed the recipe but added some seasonings with the meat and onions as suggested in other reviews. I did not have any trouble with a mushy dish or cabbage. 
 It turned out just as described . Because I did not half the recipe, I had tons leftover to share with neighbors during this quarantine (left on their doorstep).
This is the most boring dinner I've ever made. Not sure where the flavor is supposed to come from....

I had not made cabbage rolls for years because they are time consuming, but new hubby has inspired me to try this recipe and it was a winner! Next time I think I‚Äôll freeze half since it‚Äôs just the two of us.

I cooked the onions with the beef and added in minced garlic at the end. You REALLY need to add way more seasoning. I added fresh oregano, thyme, a pinch of crushed red pepper, etc... Also I made sure to not chop the cabbage too small.
Delicious!!
Soooooo bland.
Added bacon

It was good. I too added more of the spices.
Will make it again!
If I make again I would add much more spices. It takes much longer to bake then what the instructions say. I didn't really think the apple added a different flavor so I would probably leave out.
Add ins mushrooms
Really good and very easy. I think I might spice it up a bit, adding some garlic.... more onion and probably more rice.

I like this way better than cabbage rolls because I am a cabbage-aholic, and this dish gives you cabbage in every bite. I think the addition of carrots (in the video) is genius - not because I need to add veggies, but because it tastes great. The one issue: My rice overcooked. When I make this again, I may simply add the rice later. I made a couple of changes: I added garlic powder when cooking the beef because I cannot stand the smell of unseasoned hamburger cooking, and I'm glad I did because it amped up the flavor. The other change: I used my own canned tomatoes instead of store-bought "crushed", and I braced them with a small amount of my own canned tomato sauce. One more thing: 
 I cut the cabbage in large 1" pieces, which is probably why mine did not turn mushy. All in all, this recipe is a keeper, and I will be adding to the rotation.
It was perfect and easy peasy!!

I made it vegetarian by replacing the hamburger with 2 cans red beans. Also used brown rice instead of white rice by using 3/4 cup instead of 1 cup. You could also add more broth if you wanted to have 1 cup of brown rice. I would have given it 5 stars but I think it needs some seasoning. Let you know next time around!
This is so much easier than rolling up the meat/rice mixture in cabbage leaves. We throughly enjoyed it and will make this a staple for dinners. Good one for company too.

5 stars only after I modified the recipe quite a bit. Seems like the rice didn't cook when I tried mixing it together uncooked to start so then: 

I made spagetti sauce from scratch with: 15 oz tomato sauce, 14.5 oz diced tomatoes with basil and garlic, one sweet onion, 1/2 cup finely chopped carrots, two finely chopped zucchinni, 4 garlic cloves, 10 oz turkey sausage.

Made 2 cups of short grain brown rice in a rice cooker with some olive oil to keep it moist.

Then I mixed the spagetti sauce with the rice in a large pot.

Cut up a head of cabbage and barely cooked it in two divided batches in 1 Tbsp olive oil until it blanched (about 5 minutes each batch) then layered everything.

Lightly grease a 9 X 13 casserole dish with a bit of olive oil or nonstick spray then layer like lasagne:

Cabbage
Spagetti sauce and rice mixture
Grated cheddar cheese and grated Jack (I used Mozarella)

then I cooked up the second batch of cabbage and repeated the layering:

Cabbage
Spagetti sauce and rice mixture
Grated cheddar cheese and grated Jack or Mozarella

Cover with Aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes.
Remove aluminum foil and bake for another 20 minutes.

Thanks to the many other cooks whose recipes combined to make this one finally the winner for my family.
Love this recipe, so much easier than making cabbage rolls. Perfect with a big dollop of sour cream on top and even better the next day!
Made this last night. It took much longer than an hour. By then the rice was mushy. It really didn't have any flavor at all. Needs more spices maybe but I wouldn't know what.

Thought this was very good. I used brown rice as that is all I had worked out fine . I halved the recipe and other than adding a dash of cayenne pepper followed recipe. I would absolutely make this again.
An easy dish but too bland for my family. I will make with alterations next time.
I will never make regular cabbage rolls again! But we made it in a slow cooker! My kids came over to try it and they're crazy about it too! Thanks!
May add garlic and a little chili powder next time. Freezes well.
